title: Smart meter delays: 'I felt pressured into getting one in order to get the best deals'
text:
The smart meter roll-out has been extended for another four years in a victory for Telegraph Money’s campaign.

This newspaper, backed by MPs and charities such as Citizens Advice, called for the Government to take a commonsense approach to one of Britain’s biggest infrastructure projects amid a series of technical problems.

The £11bn roll-out is already £2bn over budget, with energy suppliers blaming the Government’s insistence on sticking to its original 2020 deadline.

The price will ultimately be paid for by households in the form of higher bills, although the Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy (BEIS) said the cost would be offset by savings of £19bn. But the roll-out,...
